Summary: Small Motel type accommodation. We were made very welcome upon arrival and was not charged any early check in fee. The room was clean, tidy and very comfortable. A great location for the Disney Parks, about 15-20 mins walk away. Facilities in the room included a hairdryer, iron and board microwave and a mini fridge which was great for our drinks purchased from the supermarket across the road, which is open till 4.00 am so you can get your drinks on the way back from the parks for the next day.  There is free Wi-Fi but the reception in our downstairs room was not great. One negative is there was no safe in the room so had to carry passports and all cash to the Parks each day. However, overall we would certainly stay here again.

We checked in on august 22/2022 for 2 nights through Amex platinum. We checked about 3:30 pm we talked to a clerk named Armand . He showed  us the first room which was completely filthy. We opened the refrigerator and Inside was a box of kfc chicken , a pack of moldy hot dogs and a spoil liter of MILK . To the addition the refrigerator was not on . Also on the bed was some hair . Disgusting . My friend had bug bites . Then he offered us another room which had no pillows  so he pulled it from another room which was probably not sanitized . do not stay at this hotel, male clerk out of his mind, he was upset with me because i reported him not being office for 25 minutes, i left and found another hotel close by, this clerk would not refund my money, even though he was not in office, thus i could not check in.  booking.com no help.  this guy was so out of touch, he even called my cell phone to verbally harass me for reporting him.

Very close to convention centre which was great for D23 and close to disneyland as well. Night Clerk was very helpful and polite.  Lady, who I guess is a manager or owner, who checked out was horrible.Extremely rude to me and another lady. I couldn't believe how she spoke to this woman and basically was accusing her of being on drugs as she checked her in. Spoke to me very rudely and all I wanted to do was get our cases that we left in the office.  She was also horrible to a cleaning lady which was unnecessary.   We had 2 tiny towels between us and room was old and dirty.   Breakfast was terrible.   Cheap option but I've stayed in places cheaper and far nicer.

Summary Heading: Too far away and our room was too gross... nice people though!
Summary: My husband chose this place, and although he's trying to tell everyone I did, he's going to have to make up for it someday!  I will not let him live it down...  First of all, the people that run it are very nice, and super helpful which was good considering we had to keep requesting things.  1. We had to ask for towels every day.  Then on the second night we came back from Disneyland and I was about to take the first shower, when I realized there was no longer a shower curtain!    2. There was a brown smear on one of the headboards.  Yeah, that's pretty disgusting.  Enough said.  3. The window in our room didn't lock.  At least the refrigerator and the AC did get cold.  And there was an ironing board in our room, but no iron. Also, some hooks in the bathroom would be extremely

The only redeeming factor is its proximity to the parks. Everything in the room was dated and dirty. Ironing board, but no iron. One hanger.2 towels and a bath mat, no washcloths or hand towels. One small trash bin in the bathroom. No handle on the shower and no hot water. Desk and a table but no chair. I'm not even going to go into the number of times I was woken up at night by the neighbors yelling or babys crying.

We picked this hotel because of its location. It was only about a 20 minute walk to Disneyland. The room was bigger than most hotels of this price. It was clean and comfortable enough. They are really picky about exactly how many people are in the room. So, don't think you can just add someone else to the room after booking because they WILL charge you per person per day. The breakfast wasn't anything remarkable. It was coffee, Danishes, cinnamon rolls, and a couple cereal options.  It took a couple of interactions with the staff for me to realize they weren't trying to be rude. Overall they were accommodating. I've been to a couple comparably priced hotels that I would pick above this one, but I wouldn't blacklist it.

Was a very nice room close to Disney staff was really nice. This will be our Disney trip motel from now on.There is plenty restaurants to choose from, theres little markets close. I was really impressed with this little place, and you can't beat the price at all.

I read the lower-rated reviews and had a VERY different experience.  I had nothing but a positive experience.   FREE PARKING - I called the day before my reservation to ask if I could park in their lot the morning of check in (check in is in the early afternoon and we were going to Disneyland in the morning.  The man on the phone was very nice and said sure, to just come to the desk and give my info, and I could officially check in when I got back that evening.  All this was true when I arrived.   ROOM - I had a room on the ground floor, and it was clean with the basics: towels, soaps, microwave, mini fridge, TV.  Was is a 5 star room?  No, but I also didn't pay for a 5 star room!  I was going to be at Disney all day and into the late evening, so I didn't need a room with

I came here with 4 people, the clerk claimed our reservation was only for 2 people. WRONG! He was INCREDIBLY rude, definitely the WORST service person I have ever encountered in my LIFE! Our room only had 2 threadbare, smelly towels, so I went back to the front desk to ask for a couple more towels (as we all needed to shower) and he is very hesitant to give me 2 more, takes out 2 towels from under the desk, and UNFOLDS them over the dirty countertop. One of them had a long hair in it! I politely ask for a different one, because of the hair, and he asks where the hair is! I literally pull the hair off of the towel, he scowls at me, and shuts the cabinet full of towels, then LOOKS me in the eyes and tells me they are OUT of towels! I cannot stress how rude and unhelpful this man

Went to check our hotel reservation that I made back in July for Abby’s Anaheimer Inn near Disneyland California.  I made the reservation back in July for the end of Sept and have a confirmation email for $433 for four days.  I went to check on the reservation and found that the hotel cancelled it.  I was told it wasn’t a problem as they still had rooms left and when I went to re-book, was told that they new price was $1540.  I re-iterated that I was active duty military taking my family on vacation in the middle of a transfer and that I had never received a cancellation email. Summary Heading: Plumbing Issues Caused Toilet Water To FLOOD Our Room
Summary: There are many little negative things I could say about our stay, like how noisy it is at all hours of the night if your room in by the road, but nothing compared to the plumbing issues that caused a flood in our room. Yes, its cheep, the rooms are large and the location is very close to Disneyland, but trust me, find somewhere else.   From the moment we got to the room our toilet had issues. It would slowly drain and flush, and very slowly fill back up.  So on day one of staying here, my boyfriend and I got back to our rooms at 11pm after a 14 hour day in Disney, exhausted, and noticed the toilet was fully not working. We left the room for a bit and I had left my gold diamond ring in my purse on the night stand. Came back and it was missing! AFTER the maid cleaned! Manager said the maid has been working there for 10 years and never got a complaint. And they trust her. WELL DOESN’T MATTER CAUSE YOU GOT A COMPLAINT NOW!

Summary Heading: If you are in a pinch
Summary: If you are used to staying at Marriott, Four Seasons, don't stay here. If you are used to Motel 6, then stay here. Mattresses need replaced, I could feel the springs on my back. TV is a tube tv, and the room is very, very dated. The internet, good luck. I got better signal from my Verizon myfi than the hotel internet.  The gentleman at the front desk was wonderful, super nice, professional and helpful. The lady, not so much.  Next time, I will definitely pay the extra money and stay elsewhere.

I purchased this room because it was fairly cheap. I didn't realize how close it was to Disneyland. The workers at the front desk were really nice and friendly. One of the guys asked if it was my hotel since I have the same name haha. The room was fine and basic. The tv worked which was nice since the night before we didn't have a working tv at a previous hotel. We had two cars so the only thing I didn't like was that it was $15/day for that second car since they only allow one car with one room. The parking lot is very small so I get it but I still didn't like it. Disneyland was literally diagnol from the inn. It did take about 20 minutes to walk even though it's that close because you walk through a huge parking lot for the Disneyland employees but overall it wasn't even a bad

Summary Heading: DO NOT STAY AT THIS PLACE, VERY FILTHY!!!
Summary: I stood at this Motel for a wondercon event with my fiance and cuzin. We stood for 2 nights, the room feels dirty, The bathroom did not have any towels and toilet paper.the cushion stool near the door has bad stains, the refrigerator is not cold at all, our drinks and food were warm. The neighbors were very loud and disruptive. Looking outside there are foul looking people hanging outside the motel. All at the end my fiance and cuzin had bad eye infections. I would stay clear from this place.

Summary Heading: We knew that we weren’t gonna get a five star hotel.
Summary: If it weren’t for the location the hotel would be a lot less expensive then it is. However we were happy with what we had, the room was a little dated and needs some TLC, but considering we were just sleeping here and spending our days in the park this was perfect it saved us lots of money and allowed for us to do more then if we had stayed somewhere more expensive.  The walk to downtown Disney isn’t to bad like 10-15mins, I can see it being hard if you have young kids though. Also don’t depend on the breakfast they include (very very limited). The staff is fantastic, they are always happy to help and are very accommodating. They unlocked the pool for us one night even after it was closed, and after we had checked out allowed us to stay in the parking lot while we went and got

Summary Heading: A Nice Motel with a Friendly, Helpful Staff
Summary: This property is not a boutique hotel or a quiet spa, it is a motel.  That being said, it is a fine little motel, and provides comfortable, clean rooms within walking distance (for most) of some of California's biggest attractions. The staff was friendly and always helpful, and the price was great.  The reviews I saw online scared the heck out of me.  Several times I almost cancelled my reservation because of them.  I am so happy that I didn't!  Seriously, if you don't need or expect anything more than a clean, comfortable room with a refrigerator and microwave and an older TV with a ton of cable channels, you are not going to be disappointed.    Yes, you can hear the street traffic, and we also heard the children in the room next to us, but the property is in the middle of a

Summary Heading: Good hotel for Disneyland!! Great location
Summary: This place was less than ten minutes by foot to the Disneyland hotel, as well as a Dennys next door if you don't want the free breakfast. Free parking with such a great location! I've paid much more for a nicer looking hotel that ends up being dirty and paid parking. If you're going to Disneyland, you'll be at the park all day anyways so this was a great budget stay without all the extra nonsense the chain hotels charge for. This will be our new regular choice!

Hotel was okay, good for a short stay. Close walk to everywhere we needed to go. Hotel staff was nice, got there early so they held our stuff while we visited LA before check in. Hotel room was alright, comfortable beds, bathroom was great, pool was fun, and the staff even let us stay in it past closing because we were few of the only guests in the place at that point. Continental breakfast was small, but the coffee and donuts were great! However, the TV didn't work, our window screen was broken and the window didn't lock, we arrived and there were no towels or hand soap in the room, had to call down to ask for some, and there was no service to the room unless we called to ask. There were also a few stains on the floor that were concerning, and a few clearly patched holes in the

This hotel is very nice, second time I stayed here and every time in my future I come to visit Cali I’ll be staying here, nice people, clean and very convient to walking to Disneyland can’t wait to be back

It should not even be on your site. Everything was filthy. Holes in bed cover. Stained toilet and tub. The floor was so dirty my granddaughters bottom of feet were black. They would not refund the room. There was one towel one washcloth. The towel had a hole in it. The people were very rude and no help. Would never ever recommend the hotel to anyone.

Summary Heading: Average only because of the age of the motel
Summary: The motel is ideal for visiting Disneyland. Only 15 minutes walk to Disneyland. You get what you pay for. Not fancy, but if you are there only there for sleeping, than it is more than ok. Pool and Whirlpool.

Summary Heading: 1 nights accommodation to allow us to visit Disney World
Summary: We booked this hotel due to its location to the Disney Park, we arrived much earlier than the allocated check in time and was permitted to leave our car in the hotel car park and pick the room key up later in the evening, this was excellent as we intended to spend the whole day in Disney.  The hotel is a short 20 minutes walk to Disneyland Drive which was perfect from Disney entrance and hotels.  The hotel room was very basic, featured air conditioning, free Wi-Fi and free parking, the décor was dated and shabby, this however was not an issue for us due to the short amount of time we spent in the room, the bed was huge and comfortable.  The only issue that we found was that there was only 1 towel provided.  Value for money, ideal for a 1 night stay.

First off, this is not a hotel or even an inn- it's just a motel. Don't let the name mislead you. I don't mind staying in a cheap place, and I didn't expect any amenities other than just a bed and shower from Abby's. However, this place was simply not clean and it felt unsafe the entire time. Best part of all of this is that I came home with bed bug bites on the right side of my body. Just spend whatever extra money you have elsewhere and avoid this place.

The room was very unpleasant. There were holes in the wall, lamps did not work, and the only one that did had a weird red lightbulb. The air conditioning did not work well. Also the free WiFi did not work for us either, the password they gave us just kept saying that it was incorrect. The carpeting was very dirty and when we were taking our shoes off, our feet or socks would just be black from how dirty it was. There were no towels, soap, or hangers in our room. The man who ran the desk was very rude and would act like we were being suspicious and would ignore us if we tried to ask for anything that was needed. It is not also very convenient walking distance to the entrance for the park. Spend $20 dollars more and stay elsewhere, because this was no where near worth the cost

Truly not for fussy people or those traveling with family. The a/c is nothing to brag about. It was cooler outside. One towel. No phone. The front desk people are friendly but they're talkers more than doers. There are insects in the room. Fits the old adage "you get what you pay for."

Not for the fussy people. It is a low budget hotel so if you going on a budget and are looking for a place to sleep with nice staff then it's great. They are working on updates. Any issues were address quickly.  It's walking distant to Disneyland

We have stayed at Abby's off and on for decades.  We know going in that it is definitely "get what you pay for" but usually it is dirt cheap.  We reserved the hotel late last year for a great price.  We reserved it through the hotel itself (even though it would have been a couple of $ cheaper if we reserved through the internet) because we were worried if we had to cancel.  My husband, being paranoid, confirmed it in Feb. (which was confirmed) then again the day we were leaving for the trip.  On the day we were leaving, they said the rate that we were quoted was incorrect and that we would need to pay about 30% more!  At that time, where else are we going to find a decent priced room?? The beds were hard and uncomfortable and a moth flew out of the sheets when I pulled the comforter back.  I had a run in Disneyland the next day so I called an audible and booked a room at the Best Western and went over there.

I didn't expect much as I got this room for a budget price.  Went with husband and two kids to enjoy Disneyland. Employees were very polite and helpful. Location was Ok, since there are markets and restaurants nearly. Although it it next to Simba Parking, it's not that easy to get to the parks entrance. We parked at the Mickey and friends, and had to take the tram, I don't know if there is a better way to get to the park. The breakfast is coffee, milk, hot water, croissants and danishes, and you have to eat in your room. The room had a good size, good bathroom and shower. The bed were very comfortable with new sheets and blankets. It definitely needs the carpet replaced to make it look cleaner, but if they do so, the price will increase. Summary Heading: Don't stay here!! Ridiculously Horrible Customer Service!!!
Summary: I've never rated anything ever but had to for this hotel. I booked a room and within 12 hours of that called the property to cancel it due to a change in plans. This was SEVEN months in advance of the actual reservation. They refused to cancel because it was "policy" and charged me the full amount of the room THE SAME day I completed the booking (again 7 months before my planned stay). So I paid $400, seven months in advance for a room I will not use. I reserved through Booking.com which was completely incompetent in assisting me with this situation.

Horrible customer service.  My booking was cancelled and when tried to rebook was told no, but we will keep your money.   Very rude people was given the run around for over a week.  Not worth your money.   There are a lot of better small businesses along the Disneyland route that can provide better services.

Summary Heading: A nice little Inn near Disney
Summary: The rooms were good value for money and the location to Disneyland was fantastic. One thing that stood out above the rest was the customer service. On more than one occasion the staff here went above and beyond.

The motel is in walking distance to Downtown Disney and Disneyland- about 30 minutes to the main gate. We had two adjoining rooms for a party of 8. The rooms are very basic but adequate. The staff were helpful addressing issues- biggest issue was maids leaving just enough towels for two when we had four- so had to go to office daily for things like towels, washcloths, etc. breakfast is basically sweet rolls, coffee, OJ, cereal. Overall ok place.

Summary Heading: Warning to All Aussies, " No ", Warning To Everybody
Summary: I would not recommend this Hotel to Anyone, as they Misrepresent themselves, and then Absolutely Refuse to Refund. They are Not Disabled Friendly. The only positive, is their close Proximity to Disneyland, but believe me,                 THIS IS NOT ENOUGH TO WARRANT A STAY AT ABBY'S. I booked through Booking.Com, and they were Professional enough to Partially Honor the Refund, that Abby's simply refused to. Remember, YOU WERE WARNED        They are " CHEAP "

I'll start off by being brutally honest... When I booked this trip my focus was more on entertainment than the actual room I was getting. So when I booked to this I bought it based purely off of price. So when I got there my hotel room key wouldn't work and I was a little surprised to see that the person at the front desk actually photocopies your credit card. I inquired about it and he said it's just company policy and it is secure. Needless to say I will be having my credit card company keep an eye on my spending. I get to the room and the walls could use a good wipe down. The curtains had ketchup packets shoved into the bottoms of it that had been squished. Fantastic stay! Best hotel within its price range because it's so close to Disneyland. Clean & simple rooms. Octavio rocks...ask for him!  Love the service… Loved the people… Can't say enough good stuff about this place!

If you only want to have somewhere to sleep, this place is for you. This motel invented the phrase no frills and no soap, toilet paper, washcloths... Except for location there was nothing good about this place.

Good location to Downtown Disney, you can cut through the Simba parking lot and shave off some distance. The hotel is dated. Wall could use some paint, new carpet would be a plus. I didn't get a hand towel until the last night, and no floor mat, but had 3 bath towels for one person. Plus side The bathroom area was sparkling clean. Although there wasn't much for breakfast but 2 cereals, orange juice and croissants and pastries, it was enough for me. The room was very large.

Summary Heading: Great rooms for those on a low budget!
Summary: I and my 3 teen grandchildren stayed at Abby's to experience Disneyland.  Abby's Anaheimer Inn provided parking approximately 10 minutes walk, clean and comfortable room, teens enjoyed the pool and a continental breakfast to start the next day on our two-day hopper.  We checked-out of the hotel, but management allowed us to continue parking until we finished our Disney adventure.

Excellent budget motel. The rooms were clean and fresh linen and towels supplied daily. Breakfast was more than adequate and very convenient to get to Disney.  Restaurants in close proximity were very affordable and the food was good. Convenience store across the road was open till 2am.

The hotel has huge and clean and comfortable rooms. The hotel is relatively near Disneyland--about 15min walk. Free WiFi and free breakfast is also available. There are a Denny's restaurant within 5min walk on the opposite side of the hotel.  The staff member wasn't very friendly, but he did arrange for a taxi for the next morning.  The "negative" of this hotel is that it has NO elevators/lifts. We struggled to get our luggage up the stairs to the second floor. No staff was available to help in this regard.  Also NO shuttle to the train/bus terminus which is about 5 min drive from the hotel. I really think that such a shuttle would attract more customers using the trains to/from LA or Las Vegas.

Aside from the terrible service. This room is disgusting, the cleanliness is appalling at best, the bathtub is is did repair and the beds are less then comfortable. The phone doesn't work, so God forbid something happens. The only thing good is the proximity to Disneyland.

Good things about this hotel: The rooms are very large. Not cramped at all. This was definitely a huge plus. All the rooms are non-smoking which was great! The beds were comfortable.  We slept very well. The room was very clean with no holes in the carpet or sheets. The bathroom and shower was also clean. The room was quiet despite being on a busy street. We were on the first floor and didn't hear hardly any noise at all from the floor above us. There was a microwave in the room. The front desk staff were very nice.  Note about the location : This hotel is within walking distance of the parks but it's a good long walk. At a quick pace its about 20 minutes. A slower pace about 30 minutes. When walking back after a long day at the parks even a bit longer.  Bad or negative things

Summary Heading: Cheap place to stay, relatively close to Disney
Summary: Pros:  Close to Disneyland Cheap Breakfast provided (Rolls, cereal, juice and coffee)  Cons:  Cold pool (went in March and it was unusable), Hot tub was luke warm and very algae ridden.  Towels were limited to 2 per room and they did not have enough wash cloths for each room.  Our room smelled very musty and the air conditioner made it worse. Not sure they ever changed the filter.

Summary Heading: Octavio, the manager solved the challenges I faced getting a room & did so w/ grace & professionalism.
Summary: Truthfully, I have not stayed there yet. I am going next week on the referral of a friend who was very pleased with the simple, cost-effective & clean room.  I am writing in advance because there was a glitch in the reservation that had nothing to do with the hotel (booked through one of the online services). But Octavio, the Manager went more than the extra mile to make everything MORE than right. He was friendly, yet highly professional and both service and solution oriented. The stay will be during the week of a trade show where 70,000 people have taken all the rooms!

Summary Heading: Worst customer Service and rude behavior
Summary: Hi , I don't recommend ANY ONE even taking a chance to be in this Hotel . The managers are extremely rude . They don't cancel any reservations . They don't talk properly and the rooms are extremely dirty . I would highly advice to spend another 20-30$ .
Manager Response: Dear Mr Vohra, I am confused! A terrible review just because we asked to call you back. Your reservation is for the 12th so you haven't even stayed at the property yet. A false review just for requesting to call you back. We hope our customers give us fair reviews to help improve our service for the future. False reviews are not what we strive for and defeats the purpose of reviews all together. We uphold fair and standard cancellation policies, and strive to do our best. We can only hope that customers will be fair to us in return. Wishing you the best.

Summary: Rooms are basic. Definitely need a makeover.  Appliances and ac are outdated. But with a denny's across the street, walking distance to disneyland, and free coffee and breakfast in morning... I'd say it's a pretty good value. It's a minimum of 50% cheaper than all other hotels for a reason. Can't have ur cake n eat it too

Summary Heading: Sorry to say...it was uncomfortable and unclean.
Summary: Carpets need replacing, walls /furniture were unclean and building is run down. Staff was polite. However, hotel needs work. Breakfast was okay considering price. Unfortunately, we felt very uncomfortable and only stayed one night. Sorry Abby's but please make some improvements!

This place was awful! Dirty, shabby, the bed was brutal, the "continental breakfast" was depressing. Giant roach in my room!!! Worst place I've ever stayed and the front desk clerk was horribly rude. Can't believe I gave them money to stay here. Probably would have been more comfortable sleeping on a side walk. Only perk is being close to Disney, but that is no excuse to let your establishment turn into a dump and to treat customers poorly.

Summary Heading: Bring Your Own Towels and Toilet Paper and All Will Be Well
Summary: This hotel does quite well on many counts:  it's clean, safe, affordable, within walking distance of Disneyland, has free parking, offers a complimentary continental breakfast, and has a friendly staff.  So what caused my poor rating?  Quite simply, inadequate supply of towels and toilet paper.  When we arrived to our room, I noticed we had two bath towels, and only two bath towels.  No hand towels, no washcloths, just two bath towels.  As there were three of us staying in the room, we really were hoping to receive at least one more bath towel.  Unfortunately, when we mentioned the towel situation to the front desk, we were given two hand towels and an explanation that the hotel was out of towels. Ignore all the bad reviews clean hotel  great facilities laundry, vending machines free breakfast only negative we did not get wifi in room had to go outside and stand on balcony brilliant shower with a fridge and air conditioning. Comfy bed

Summary Heading: OK - you get what you pay for
Summary: The hotel was clean enough. It is a budget hotel and you have to keep that in mind. No trouble with parking lot as some have said. Always short on towels, but I had read that so packed extras and so the shortage wasn't a problem.  Very close to Disneyland - just walk through employee parking lot so that was nice since I had small children with me.  Breakfast was minimal.  They set out fruit loops, corn flakes, milk, weak coffee, hot water, tea bags and one type of danish.  I had suspected the breakfast would not be great so I brought some muffins, fresh fruit and instant oatmeal with me so we were fine with combining what I brought with what they provided.  I felt the area was safe.  Never got wifi to work in room.

We checked in late and we were tired. Get to our room and the door handle was loose. Disregarded it as an easy fix... There was also no deadbolt on that door, and we always dead bolt ours at hotels. The beds were hard, pillows were flat. Sink and toilet both had stains or scratches in them. There was no microwave or fridge. Half the electrical outlets in the whole room didn't work because they were either old or broken.  Waking up the next morning in pain from the bed and no coffee, we go to checkout,  they  gave us our bill and looked at my husband and I and said before anything else " you both stayed here?" Summary Heading: Clean, friendly staff and close to Disneyland
Summary: When you are a budget traveller (like us) you have to be prepared for some pretty ordinary experiences. Abby's has not been ordinary - we have found the reception service extremely pleasant and helpful, the rooms are clean and do not smell musty (as do some rooms of similar vintage), the beds are extremely comfortable and the bed linen nice and clean. The pool and spa are great, especially if you have spent most of the day walking around Disneyland. We did not have a rental car but Abby's is close to grocery stores and places to eat out (recommend Marri's across the road). It is within easy walking distance to Disneyland.  The only not so great things we would mention is that our shower was either hot or cold with no in between and the microwave was a little dodgy, we would

not recommended at all, reason not hygienic, bathroom was filthy, A/C knobs were broken so u can not turn the AC on, i asked hotel reception before leaving my home, that my flight time is at 10pm and your checkout time is 11am how this will work, i been advice we'll take care of it as it is normal for us, but at the time of finalize the bill, i got charged from my credit card for one extra day that also without my consent, when i told them i already spoken to one of your employee, they denied, and one of there manager said NO YOU NEVER SPOKE WITH ANY ONE, she want me to say that i am lair, please make sure with all ur booking details before you book this place
Manager Response: Dear Mr Virdi, I would like to once again thank you for your stay with us. We take pride in taking care of our guests needs and we made every effort possible to make your stay as comfortable as possible. Room checkout is at 11am and we gladly allow, upon request, a late checkout till 12:30pm with no additional charge for guests. When "a do not disturb" sign is left at the room door till 7pm with no arrangements with the front desk, late checkout fees apply. The checkout timings were communicated at time of reservation by expedia and at time of check in at the hotel, they were also provided written on the check in paperwork. We had contacted Expedia to see if you had extended your stay through them. We even discounted the late checkout fees to alleviate your frustration. As you are well aware, there were no other issues with the room for the 3 days that you stayed with us. The room was clean, with no issues with any ammenities. We really make every effort to make guest stays comfortable and tried the best for yours.

Summary: Perfect place to sleep after Disneyland! You can save $17 in parking and walk to Disneyland. The hotel is right across the street from downtown Disney's parking lot. A good 15 minute walk and you are at the monorail in downtown disney. Customer service is A+! The Man is very accommodating! My family got 2 rooms and we were able to get our room cards before the 2pm check in time.  Our rooms were clean and everything worked great! A/C was super cold, plenty of hot water for showers and enough towels for my family. This is not holiday Inn so don't expect everything to be updated. But it's the best deal close to disneyland and in a very safe location. We walked home after disneyland closed and midnight and felt very safe!
Manager Response: Thank you for your stay with us,  we look forward to your next visit.

Summary: Abby's Anaheimer Inn is a cozy place at crossroads. Its a very convenient location. Staff is very cordial.  Rooms are huge, a bit old but not stale. Carpets need to be desperately changed. They should be strict about not allowing shoes if they have to maintain the carpet.  Small pantry type breakfast located near the reception, Nothing fancy at all. Good to come back after Disneyland, have a nice shower and sleep :)
Manager Response: Thank you for your stay with us, look forward to your next one!

Summary: I booked here simply for the price! Super cheap. Was worried the room wasn't going be good but was pleasantly surprise! Room wad clean, bed was comfy! Close to Disneyland and even close to a bus stop in case you don't want to walk. Everything worked out well here, only thing is wifi wouldn't work/connect. Other than that though, no issues! Would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your stay with us, look forward to your next visit

Summary: If you are on a budget this is the place. I don´t think there´s a closer place from Disneyland. We picked this hotel for our honeymoon (We weren´t looking for something romantic, so don´t judge) because we wanted to spend 2 days in Disneyland. We stayed for 3 nights and it was pretty awesome. Room is ok, hot water at all times, cable TV, king size bed for my wife and me and towels. Every day the room got cleaned while we were on the park all day. At the end of the day we were pretty tired so the fact that the hotel is only 10 min walking from Disneyland is pretty convenient if you don´t want to spend on transportation. Also the park opened at 10AM so we got time to wake up at 8AM, grab some donuts, cereal, coffee and orange juice for breakfast, go to Food for Less which is also
Manager Response: Thank you for your stay, congratulations and hope to see you on your anniversaries too :)

Summary: We have stayed in some low budget places but this dump was not even remotely clean. Curtains torn and stained, bed spread had dried food stains. Bugs alive and dead were everywhere. None of the air conditioners work even though they claim air conditioning. They just say "it must have just broke we will call someone tomorrow." Its a 2 mile walk to entrance of Disneyland no matter what they tell you. Our daughter had some type of bug bite on her stomach and back in the morning. Absolutely disgusting dump. My brother stayed in a room next to us and he said there was a guy dealing drugs on the top floor all afternoon. Pool was filled with dirt and dead bugs. Beyond horrible.
Manager Response: Thank you for your stay with us, we really strive to take care of our guests during their stay with us. It is our every effort to provide safe and clean premises to our guests. As we informed booking.com that no issues were brought to our front desk and management during your stay and we have had many guests stay in the rooms since April with no such issues. We had really hoped you would give us a fair review.

Summary Heading: Clean, quiet, comfortable.. Will stay again
Summary: Stayed at Abby's during a family trip to Disneyland. Before we even took in any luggage I checked in and inspected the room. Because of some lower reviews I was worried about cleanliness, but I literally found nothing unclean (even though I unmade the beds, flipped the mattress, peeked in all drawers, etc.. I was thorough!) the motel is a little bit older, nothing fancy, but was cleaned very well. The tiny air conditioning unit kept the room super cold. The continental breakfast some people have reviewed badly, was very adequate (juice, water, milk, multiple types of cereal and pastries) and we added some fruit of our own we bought at a Walmart located about three blocks away. And if the free breakfast isn't enough for you, there's a Denny's right across the street! A big bonus
Manager Response: Thank you for your stay with us, I am glad we were able to meet your needs during your stay with us.

Summary Heading: Stay here only if you need it to sleep
Summary: The hotel was very run down. The pillows on the bed were terrible. We were barely given enough towels. The breakfast provided wasn't really a breakfast, it was coffee and ice cold croissants or danish. The bed wasn't too bad a little hard. I would recommend only staying here if you wanted somewhere to sleep but you plan on being out the entire day. You can see Disneyland parking lot from the hotel, but it was still a bit of a walk to actually get there.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, thank you for your stay with us. We are a family friendly motel and provide a basic continental breakfast for our guests. We provide, coffee/tea, 2 cereals, danishes, croissants and orange juice to help give our guests a jump start to their day. We really do make every effort to provide clean and safe amenities to all our guests. We hope you will give us another try for your future stays in the Disney Resort area.

Summary: I was very displeased with this place.  We drove from Portland, OR to San Diego Ca.  We decided to stop in Anaheim for the night after a long day of driving.  I was looking for a nice, reasonable priced place to stay for the night.  I didn't need fancy but I didn't want to be too cheap either.  This place seemed nice from the pictures, but pictures can be deceiving.  The carpet in there was filthy, I would not walk around barefoot in there.  I did at first when we got there then soon realized the carpet felt like it had never been cleaned, who knows what was on there.  The room and bed looked run down.  I was very displeased and definitely will not be staying there again.

Summary Heading: Everything we wanted for our Mini-Vacation
Summary: This Motel is very clean, one block from Downtown Disney, and easy to get to from the freeway.  We paid $136 (tax included) for two nights during the week, just to get away from our home in San Diego, and we loved our stay!  It isn't fancy or luxurious, like a lot of Disney-tourists would want, but it had everything: a microwave, fridge, like a thousand different cable channels, and my wife(who is a housekeeper) can attest that the rooms are very clean.  We walked around the room barefooted (the barefoot test) and the soles of our feet didn't change color!  lol...      Oh, and there was free wifi, unlike the $20 a day wifi you might get at a luxury chain... Not only that, but my wife and I were able to watch the Disneyland Fireworks from the Parking lot!  How romantic!  What
Manager Response: Thank you for your stay, we look forward to your next stay with us.

Summary Heading: Worth every penny!!! Family friendly and awesome!
Summary: We stayed 8 days and never had any issues, it was clean, close to Disney and family friendly, each day the room was cleaned ((house keeping took the time to tuck in all of my kids build a bears into special beds each night making each night magical)) and they served a great breakfast for a family on the go! They had a laundry room and it was less then $2 to wash and dry each load, the manager was v-e-r-y friendly and went overboard to make us comfortable, to top it all off, it was wayyyyyyyyyy cheaper then the place we stayed last year and we were within the same walking distance!  Will be back next March without hesitation, because it was within walking distance, a nice clean bed to lay our heads, nice air conditioning unit, a awesome shower and everyone was very welcoming!
Manager Response: Thank you for your stay with us. I am so glad your family had a great time.

Summary Heading: Cute hotel but sooooo far from Disneyland!
Summary: I was nervous to book this hotel because of all the bad reviews-- I can't attest to anyone else's experiences, but we LOVED this hotel! The front desk was very helpful (even loaned me his personal phone charger when I realised I'd lost mine), our room was impeccable (believe me, we went over it with a fine tooth comb after reading some of the TA reviews!), and the shower was literally the best hotel shower I have ever had! The breakfast is mostly cereal and pastries, but it was fine to just get something in your stomach before hitting the parks.   Now for the bad: be warned, this hotel is a good mile from Disneyland. If you're planning on walking, this may not be a good option for you. It was fine for two girls in their twenties but boy, it was a long walk back every night!

I stayed at this hotel with my boyfriend 12/16-12/19 for our Disneyland vacation. We travel a few times a year and always stay at budget hotels. As such, we do not expect to get more than what we paid for and this hotel satisfied our basic needs - a place to shower and sleep - and it seemed decently clean. That said, our overall experience here unfortunately was poor. We had a few security issues with the room, breakfast was not up-to-par (I'd rather not have a free breakfast than have one with dead bugs in it...), and the front desk manager that we dealt with was fairly rude. To be fair, the rest of the staff that we met were polite. Overall, I would NOT recommend this hotel.  A more detailed version: We arrived around 11:30 pm on the first night (Tuesday) and were exhausted.

This is the dirtiest hotel I've ever stayed at in Anaheim. Close to the park but not worth it. There was stains on the carpet, curtains, comforter, and the foot stool. The tub had balls of hair and a big patched up hole.  A mirror that was sealed to the wall in front of the bed (creepy) and the outside walkway had 2 old toilets and overflowing trash cans.

My fiancé and I stayed here to go to Disneyland. We were literally only in our room to sleep and shower. For that being said it's a great deal and great location. It's about a 15 walk to Disneyland going through downtown Disney. So the towels don't match who cares neither do the ones I have at home. They have old box tv but again who cares it works and I have them at home as well. They didn't bother my room at all we stayed two nights and paid about $100 and that was worth it to us. We would definitely be staying here again.

Pros: close to disneyland, cheap, free breakfast and parking. Cons: very old! Noisy, on a heavy traffic street so you can hear everything! Beds are rocks! Carpet and furniture stained and filthy, our bare feet were dirty after walking around in our room. Towels are falling apart. The bathroom ceiling was leaking! No tissues, ice bucket or hand towels. Unacceptable and a waste of time, had the worst night and wasn't worth complaining about, staff was incompetent. The following morning stated he forgot to give us a parking pass, we could've been towed!!

Summary Heading: Good Location for Disneyland but low budget
Summary: This is not a fancy place by any means, it is a place to sleep. There was a hole in the bathroom door, all the words were worn off the air conditioner so you couldn't tell what you were setting it on, the remote wouldn't work so I had to get up to change the channel or turn it off. That being said it's a cheap place to lay your head and sleep after a long day at Disneyland.  The best part is the location you can walk across the street, go through the cast parking lot and you are in downtown disney!!!! For that alone the price was right, as you get what you pay for

Summary Heading: My visit to California was nice because of them
Summary: People there were friendly and really helpful. Made us feel welcome with the beautiful smile on their faces all the day long. rooms were pretty clean and comfortable . We had a room on ground floor. view for the garage but were nice every morning when people open their room' doors and have tea and enjoy sun and calmness. small nice pool.we parked our car for three days and took a wake daily to the Disneyland and it was nice to rest ourselves from driving . I would go there again and again .

This was the second time we had stayed at Abby's and we were not disappointed the staff are extremely friendly, the rooms are comfortable and clean and surprisingly quiet for how close to the road and Disney that they are.  It not the Ritz but for the money and for how close to everything it is this is a great place to stay!

Summary Heading: Great location but not much else
Summary: If you are on a budget this is a good place to stay. It is about 15 minutes walk to the park. We were staying in the Disney hotel and arrived late so it was fine but you would not want to spend too much time in the room. There is a small pool area and the room was large and clean and if that is all you need its fine. Don't wait for breakfast. this is a pastry or cereal from the office. much better to get in the park as early as you can.

We booked a room for four nights. It was to be for myself, husband, & 6 year old grand daughter - visiting Disneyland. The booking was for three but when we arrived we were told that the maximum number of occupants allowed was two but if we paid ten extra dollars each night, we could have the extra person in the room.we were also supposed to get a military rate but were told that because we didn't book the room with them we could not get it although that is how it was booked.The best thing about it was the location - you can walk to catch the Disneyland Monorail in ten minutes. Summary Heading: Great location, just what we needed
Summary: We stayed here for one night in between visits to Disneyland.It was very easy to find and we happily walked the short distance. The room was clean and we were so shattered from a day at Disney I honestly cannot remember what the bed was like. Reception was friendly, it was perfect for what we wanted and such a brilliant price.

We checked in about 3 pm and was given a room. They make a copy of your credit card and drivers license. This is of concern to have this personal info floating around.  When we went to the room it haden't been cleaned so we notified the front desk and waited about 20 mins. for it to be cleaned. The room was big with newer carpet, paint and tile and it didn't smell. It had a microwave, small refrigerator and coffee maker. The next morning I found a roach in the bathroom sink and promptly killed it. Then when I was exiting the shower I found a cleaning lady stating she was there to collect towels before she cleaned the room as she stared at my male appendage since I was naked and trying to grab a towel. Me being naked didn't seem to phase her at all. She watched me dry off and we

Summary Heading: I would never stay here again!
Summary: The photos are completely misleading. When I arrived to check-in the concierge attempted to over charge my account by 75 dollars not thinking I would say something. When I addressed this issue they simply stated that they thought they hadn't charged me. The room was very dirty and smelled of dirty socks and mold. The tv did not work, the wifi also did not work. The beds and chairs had stains all over them. Uncomfortable mattress and very displeased with the breakfast. Even on a budget I would never stay here again.

this hotel is VERY close to Disneyland (we walked across the carpark to get in) this took us through downtown Disney.  The room itself was very spacious although not austenacious it had everything we needed.  It was right opposite the laundry room used for the hotel linen, tucked in the back which made it a fairly quiet room plus we were the last room on the row.  The hotel staff were extremely helpful and friendly particularly Brian and Octavio.  The pool and spa were lovely and we used them several times during our stay.  There is a Denny's (open 24hrs) right across the street plus a small supermarket which sells premade sandwiches and fruit plus lots of other essentials.

Summary Heading: RUN don't walk AWAY FROM THIS MOTEL
Summary: Extremely rude management.  Room was filthy.  AC was caked in dust.  There was a pile of dead ants on the floor and in the sink.  The sheet wasn't attached to the mattress.  The blanket was ripped in the middle and the pillows set a new definition for lumpy.  Walls are super thin and when you complain that neighbor is screaming at an already loud TV while you're sleeping they tell you "too bad, deal with it."  There was no hot water in the morning but there was a big insect running across the floor.  Even at $60/ night you don't get what you pay for.

Seriously can not complain enough about this place. The "free Wi-Fi" does not work in the rooms you have to sit outside your room to use it. The handicapped rooms are far from handicap accessible. The only thing they did to qualify it handicap is put a raised toilet seat. Did not even have grab bars or wide enough doors. The room was tiny and had freaking cockroaches. The manager was hugely argumentative and rude. The remotes don't even work for their ancient TVs. The walls are extremely thin, the bath tubs don't even have anything to plug them, you have to beg for towels and then you are only allowed 2 even when there is 4 people in the room. We stayed here for 4 nights and found our stay generally hassle free. Keep in mind that this is one of the cheapest place to stay in the Disney vicinity. You won't get first class service because you're not paying for one.   Location is near Disney but it's a long walk from the hotel. Just use the money you saved in using this hotel to pay the $16 Disney parking fee. You'll need that walking energy inside the theme park.   Parking is a little cramped. If you arrive late at night, you may end up with no parking space.   The room we stayed in (205) is newly painted and the beds were comfortable. TV was old but still functional. Room was clean and since the room we got is far from the road, vehicle noise is minimal.   Wifi is intermittent. I noticed that you can't connect during

After reading reviews, I booked this hotel. I just wanted something simple, with free parking and walking distance from Disneyland. This hotel fit the bill. However, it was far below standards. The beds were rock hard, and I'm not exaggerating. My husband and I didn't get a good nights sleep one night. Each bed had only 2, flat pillows. The television was from the '90's.  We were not there to watch tv, but it just shows how unappealing and out-dated the room was. The furniture was worn and some were broken, fixed with tape. There were no black-out blinds, just 2 old and out dated sheers, overlapped. It did nothing to block the parking lot lights.
